title: Heat Lamp and Heat Plate Differences | Cackle Hatchery

tasks.task: Caring for mail-order baby chicks upon delivery.
subtasks: Setting up a brooder with a reflector lamp.
Ensuring proper temperature for the chicks (100-105 degrees at floor level).
Using a 125-watt bulb for approximately 25 chicks.
Providing a heat source that warms the air around the chicks.
Adjusting the heat source based on chick behavior (huddling indicates too cold; spreading out indicates just right).
Transitioning chicks to a non-light heat source after 7-10 days.
